items.title: Road to the Postseason: Sept. 14
items.summary: The Indians are on the verge of becoming the third team to claim a postseason spot, which they can do as early as Thursday. The Cubs hold onto the National League Central lead, while the Mariners make a big jump in the American League Wild Card race.
items.content: The Indians are on the verge of becoming the third team to claim a postseason spot, which they can do as early as Thursday. The Cubs hold onto the National League Central lead, while the Mariners make a big jump in the American League Wild Card race.

items.title: Managers Postgame: Tito on 21st straight win
items.summary: Indians manager Terry Francona discusses his team setting a new AL record with its 21st consecutive victory with a win over the Tigers.
items.content: Indians manager Terry Francona discusses his team setting a new AL record with its 21st consecutive victory with a win over the Tigers.

alternate.title: Managers Postgame: Tito on 21st straight win

items.title: Explaining possible postseason tiebreakers
items.summary: Is this the year anarchy envelopes the MLB standings and a mess of math and travel overtakes the early part of the postseason schedule? One figures it's bound to happen eventually, and a 2017 season with a crazy assortment of clubs still in contention with scant weeks remaining -- especially in that American League Wild Card race -- is a good candidate for chaos.
items.content: Is this the year anarchy envelopes the MLB standings and a mess of math and travel overtakes the early part of the postseason schedule? One figures it's bound to happen eventually, and a 2017 season with a crazy assortment of clubs still in contention with scant weeks remaining -- especially in that American League Wild Card race -- is a good candidate for chaos.

items.title: Tribe seeks 22nd straight win with KC up next
items.summary: The American League-leading Indians have already stamped their name in the record books with their historic winning streak, and they have a chance to continue their magical run on Thursday night.
items.content: The American League-leading Indians have already stamped their name in the record books with their historic winning streak, and they have a chance to continue their magical run on Thursday night.

alternate.title: Tribe seeks 22nd straight win with KC up next

items.title: Indians go for 22nd win in a row on MLB.TV
items.summary: The American League-leading Indians put their 21-game win streak on the line when they open a four-game series at home against the AL Wild Card-contending Royals as part of today's 12-game Major League schedule streaming live on MLB.TV.
items.content: The American League-leading Indians put their 21-game win streak on the line when they open a four-game series at home against the AL Wild Card-contending Royals as part of today's 12-game Major League schedule streaming live on MLB.TV.

alternate.title: Indians go for 22nd win in a row on MLB.TV

items.title: Belisle staking claim to closer role
items.summary: Twins manager Paul Molitor said he's not one for titles, and hasn't named veteran Matt Belisle as his official closer, despite him picking up a team-high seven saves since All-Star Brandon Kintzler was traded to the Nationals on July 31.
items.content: Twins manager Paul Molitor said he's not one for titles, and hasn't named veteran Matt Belisle as his official closer, despite him picking up a team-high seven saves since All-Star Brandon Kintzler was traded to the Nationals on July 31.

alternate.title: Belisle staking claim to closer role

items.title: Goldy joins D-backs lore with 1,000th hit
items.summary: With a double in the third inning off the Rockies' German Marquez in Wednesday night's 8-2 D-backs win, Paul Goldschmidt joined Luis Gonzalez as the only players to record 1,000 hits in an Arizona uniform.
items.content: With a double in the third inning off the Rockies' German Marquez in Wednesday night's 8-2 D-backs win, Paul Goldschmidt joined Luis Gonzalez as the only players to record 1,000 hits in an Arizona uniform.

alternate.title: Goldy joins D-backs lore with 1,000th hit

items.title: Upton's bat carries weight for Angels
items.summary: Justin Upton hit his first home run with the Angels on Wednesday in a 9-1 win over the Astros, which gave him 100 RBIs this season and 250 home runs for his career.
items.content: Justin Upton hit his first home run with the Angels on Wednesday in a 9-1 win over the Astros, which gave him 100 RBIs this season and 250 home runs for his career.

alternate.title: Upton's bat carries weight for Angels

items.title: Cautious Contreras has adventurous game
items.summary: The Cubs want Willson Contreras to be careful on the bases, and he did just that in the third inning on Wednesday night. The trouble is, he and rookie Ian Happ messed up some basic baserunning.
items.content: The Cubs want Willson Contreras to be careful on the bases, and he did just that in the third inning on Wednesday night. The trouble is, he and rookie Ian Happ messed up some basic baserunning.
